etymology.description: semantic 衤(衤) (yī, "clothing") + phonetic 因(因) (yīn) = fabric-related surface -> mat
etymology.interpretation: The character 裀(yīn, "mat") combines the silk radical, related to fabrics, with 因(yīn), indicating pronunciation, to convey the meaning of a fabric item like a mat or cushion. This is a variant of 茵(茵) (yīn, "mat") used specifically for fabric-related objects.

examples.chinese: 妈妈铺了一个裀(媽媽鋪了一個裀)，让客厅更温暖(讓客廳更溫暖)。
examples.pinyin: māmā pū le yī gè yīn, ràng kètīng gèng wēnnuǎn.
examples.english: Mother laid out a mat to make the living room warmer.

examples.chinese: 小猫睡在裀上(小貓睡在裀上)。
examples.pinyin: xiǎo māo shuì zài yīn shàng.
examples.english: The kitten is sleeping on the mat.

examples.chinese: 他用新买的裀(他用新買的裀)，装饰了房间(裝飾了房間)。
examples.pinyin: tā yòng xīn mǎi de yīn, zhuāngshì le fángjiān.
examples.english: He used the newly bought mat to decorate the room.
